intro: Nephrocarya horizontalis, commonly known as the horizontal nutmeg, is a rare and unique plant belonging to the Lauraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, horizontally oriented fruit that resembles a nutmeg in appearance. The plant is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, with a strong aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a critically endangered species in its natural range.
